question: Adding a progestin to the estrogenic component of hormone replacement therapy for postmenopausal women provides which of the following effects?

answers.option: Reduces the risk for endometrial cancer
Provides better control of problematic hot flushes

question: Which of the following is not a therapeutic use of estrogen?
The death of a mother during pregnancy or within 42 days of birth is termed as which of the following?
Which of the following vaccines of the expanded program on immunization (EPI) schedule is administered intradermally?
In the expanded program of immunization (EPI), which vaccine is ideally administered at 6 weeks of age in a newborn?

answers.option: Rotavirus, pneumococcal, pentavaccine, oral polio vaccine

question: Which of the following is the cut-off for fast breathing in a child who is 2 to 12 months old, according to IMNCI?

A 4-year-old female is brought by her parents to the clinic due to early bilateral development of breasts. There is no history of headaches or vision problems. Family history for any similar problems is also negative. On examination, her vitals are normal. On anthropometry, her weight is 13 kg, and her height is on the 3rd standard deviation. Her Tanner staging is stage 3. What is the expected age of this child according to the Tanner staging?

A 2-day-old baby presents with jaundice noticed on the first day of life. On examination, the baby has fair reflexes, and the jaundice is up to the ankles. The mother's blood group is A- and that of the baby is A+. What is the most appropriate investigation to confirm the diagnosis of this patient?

A 35-year-old obese woman conceives for the first time following treatment for infertility. She is taking multivitamins. Ultrasound examination reveals twin pregnancy, She is concerned about delivering prematurely. Which of the following factors in this woman is the most likely to lead to preterm delivery?

A baby is delivered by spontaneous vaginal delivery after 35 weeks of gestation. Soon after the delivery, the attending nurse notices the baby getting cold. What is the best immediate step for warming the baby in the delivery room?

A new mother presents to the clinic with complaints of pain and sore nipples. The physician observes the mother feeding the baby. To achieve good positioning and attachment, which of the following practices should be avoided?

answers.option: More of the areola should be visible above than below
Baby's head needs to be supported only
The baby's lower lip should be everted
The baby's chin should touch the breast
Baby should be in close contact to the mother

question: A baby born at 38 weeks of gestation, and having a good APGAR score is being assessed in the delivery room. On examination, the baby has a symmetrically low birth weight, height, and head circumference. The baby is erythematous and jittery, but the remaining systemic examination is normal. Which of the following post-natal problems is this baby likely to have?

A term baby is delivered via elective lower-segment cesarean section. The baby is placed under a radiant warmer, dried, and provided with suctioning of the nose and mouth. The baby has labored breathing, cyanosis, and a heart rate of 75 beats/minute. Positive pressure ventilation is performed for 15 seconds following which the heart rate decreases to 65 beats/minute. Which of the following is the next step in the management of this patient?

answers.option: Adjust the mask and reposition the airway

question: A 16-year-old female presents to the gynecology clinic with a complaint of primary amenorrhea. Her height is 154 cm, and her body mass index is 24 kg/m². On examination, she has normal secondary sexual characteristics. Investigations reveal normal FSH, LH, and estrogen levels. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old unmarried female presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of bleeding from her gums and heavy menstrual bleeding since menarche. On examination, she is pale, and her abdomen is soft and non-tender. Which of the following is the most suitable examination in this case?

A 25-year-old female with parity 1+0 presents to the clinic with sudden onset of pain associated with nausea. On examination, a pelvic/ abdominal mass is felt separately from the uterus. What is the most common benign ovarian tumor in this age group?

A 28-year-old female gravida 3 para 2+0 presents to the clinic at ten weeks of pregnancy with lower abdominal pain. On examination, the abdomen is soft, non-tender, and cervical excitation is positive. What is the gold standard test for confirming the diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy?

A 23-year-old unmarried female presents to the clinic with complaints of the prolonged menstrual cycle, weight gain, and hirsutism. Her body mass index is 35 kg/m². What is the first-line treatment in this case?

A 15-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of not having started menstruation. Her elder sisters had their periods at the age of 13. On examination, the external genitals are normal. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 19-year-old unmarried female presents to the clinic complaining of severe hirsutism. Her body mass index is 26 kg/m². Her ultrasound abdomen and pelvis are normal. Her serum FSH is 4.4 IU/L, and her serum LH is 16 IU/L. What is the most appropriate investigation to perform next in this patient?

A 32-year-old female gravida 7 para 6+0 presents to the emergency department with complaints of abdominal pain and per vaginal bleeding. She is 34 weeks pregnant. On examination, the symphysis-fundal height is 36 cm, her abdomen is tense and tender, and fetal heart sound is absent. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 26-year-old female primigravida presents to the emergency room with generalized tonic-clonic fits and raised blood pressure. She is currently 34 weeks pregnant. On examination, her blood pressure is 160/100 mm Hg, symphysis-fundal height is 32 cm, and the fetus has a cephalic presentation. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female primigravida presents to the clinic at 32 weeks of pregnancy. On examination, the symphysis-fundal height is 26 cm, and the fetus has a cephalic presentation. Fetal growth restriction is suspected. Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation to confirm the diagnosis?

A 26-year-old female gravida 2 para 1+0 presents to the emergency room at 34 weeks of pregnancy, with a complaint of absent fetal movements for one day. Ultrasound shows a single intrauterine dead fetus. Which of the following is the most appropriate definition of intrauterine fetal death?

answers.option: Fetus dies in utero after 18 weeks of gestation
Fetus dies in utero after 24 weeks of gestation
Fetus dies in utero after 10 weeks of gestation
Fetus dies in utero after 15 weeks of gestation
Fetus dies in utero after 12 weeks of gestation

question: A 60-year-old female para 5+0 presents to the clinic with a complaint of postcoital bleeding for 3 months. She is currently a smoker. On examination, there is irregular growth on the cervix. What is the most common type of cervical cancer?

A 52-year-old female para 3+0 presents to the clinic with complaints of vaginal discharge and postcoital bleeding for 6 months. On speculum examination, the cervix appears to be normal. Which of the following is a screening test for cervical cancer?

A 30-year-old nulliparous female, married for 3 years, had a cervical biopsy for an abnormal cervical smear. Her histopathology shows micro-invasive cervical cancer with horizontal spread <7 mm, and depth of stromal invasion <3mm. What is the most appropriate treatment option for her?

A 30-year-old nulliparous female, married for 3 years, presents to the clinic with a complaint of not being able to conceive. Her periods and hormonal profile are normal. Her husband's semen analysis is normal. Hysterosalpingography reveals bilaterally blocked fallopian tubes. What is the best treatment option for this patient?

A couple presents to the clinic with a history of subfertility for 2 years. The wife's hormonal profile and ultrasound scan are normal. The husband's semen analysis shows a sperm concentration of 5 million per mL, sperms/ejaculate of 4 million, progressive motility of 10%, and normal morphology of 2%. What is the next step in management?

A 25-year-old female presents to the clinic at 7 weeks of gestational amenorrhea, and per vaginal spotting. On examination, the cervical os is closed and there is mild per vaginal bleeding. Ultrasound shows absent fetal heart sounds. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 25-year-old female presents to the clinic at 7 weeks of gestational amenorrhea, and per vaginal spotting. Missed miscarriage is suspected. What is the picture of missed miscarriage on an ultrasound?

answers.option: Gestational sac diameter more than 10 mm with no fetal pole
Gestational sac diameter more than 20 mm with no fetal pole
Gestational sac diameter more than 15 mm with fetal pole
Absent fetal heart with fetal pole
No yolk sac and absent gestational sac

question: A 47-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of night sweats, mood changes, and difficulty in sleep for 6 months. There is a history of irregular uterine bleeding per vagina for a year followed by a hysterectomy 8 months ago. What is the investigation of choice?

A 47-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of night sweats, mood changes, and difficulty in sleep for 6 months. There is a history of irregular uterine bleeding per vagina for a year followed by a hysterectomy 8 months ago. What is the next step in the management of this patient?

A 41-year-old female presents to the clinic with regular and heavy menstrual bleeding. She has four children and does not want any more pregnancies. On examination, her uterus is normal in size, mobile, and non-tender. What is the best management option for this patient?

A 35-year-old female presents to the emergency room with 8 weeks of amenorrhea with a positive urine pregnancy test. Transvaginal ultrasound shows no intrauterine pregnancy and normal adnexa. Her serum beta HCG levels are 1500 IU/L. She is vitally stable. What is the most appropriate diagnosis for this patient?

A 22-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of vaginal discharge for 3 months associated with lower abdominal pain. On examination, her cervix is covered with a mucopurulent discharge. What is the investigation of choice for this patient?

A 22-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of lower abdominal pain and foul-smelling vaginal discharge. She is prescribed antibiotics for gonorrhea. She is concerned about the future implications. Which of the following is the most important future implication in this case?

A 23-year-old female para 1+0 recently delivered twin babies by cesarean section. She wants to use medroxyprogesterone acetate three-monthly injections for contraception. What is the mechanism of action of this drug?

answers.option: Thickening of the cervical mucous plug

question: A 25-year-old female para 1+0 presents to the clinic requesting contraception. She is a known case of epilepsy and is currently taking carbamazepine to control it. She delivered her first child 1 month ago by lower segment cesarean section. She wants long-term contraception lasting at least 3 years. Which of the following is the most appropriate method of contraception for this patient?

A condition in which the reproductive process is accomplished in a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being and is not merely the absence of disease or disorder of the reproductive process. Which of the following terms is best described by this definition?

A woman in prolonged labor in a remote village in Sindh is in distress. The family waits for her to deliver normally at home and then finally realize they might need to go to the hospital. They have to wait for the father-in-law to arrive and make the decision about whether to go to the hospital or not since he is the head of the family and they are not sure if they have the time or monetary resources. According to the three-delays model, which type of delay is depicted in this scenario?

answers.option: Delay in decision to seek care
Delay due to the poor status of the woman
Delay in provision of appropriate healthcare

question: Which of the following is a pillar of safe motherhood?

A biopsy of a breast lesion of a 40-year-old female shows a uniform population of cells with oval or round nuclei and small nucleoli involving ducts and lobules. The basement membranes are intact. These cells are negative for the E-cadherin antibody stain. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 55-year-old female presents with a 3-month history of postmenopausal bleeding. When she was 48 years old, she was diagnosed with endometrial hyperplasia on biopsy. However, she never returned for follow-up and never received treatment. Which of the following conditions is the most likely cause of her abnormal bleeding?
According to optimum breastfeeding guidelines, when should breastfeeding be started?

answers.option: Within half to one hour of birth

question: A two-year-old child presents to the clinic with sunken eyes, an inability to drink, and skin pinch going back very slowly. According to the IMNCI guidelines, which plan of diarrhea management will be applied in this case?

A 25-year-old female who is a mother of a month-old infant presents to the clinic with a complaint of a unilateral painful breast. On examination, the breast is swollen and tender, the nipple is erythematous, and the patient has a fever. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old female presents with a palpable breast mass of 2 cm. Mammography shows calcifications and a radiopaque mass. On biopsy, there is an increased number of acini that are compressed and distorted in the central portion of the lesion, in a fibrous stroma. Preserved double layer of the epithelium is present in immunohistochemistry. No nuclear atypia is identified. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old female presents with a palpable 4 cm lump in her breast. On mammography, microcalcifications are identified. On biopsy, proliferation of epithelial cells limited to ducts and lobules by the basement membrane is observed. These ducts have a central area of necrosis and the epithelial cells have pleomorphic, high-grade nuclei and mitotic activity. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 35-year-old female is diagnosed with lobular carcinoma. What is the hallmark of this tumor?

answers.option: Amplification of HER2 gene on chromosome 17
Biallelic loss of expression of CDH1 gene

question: A 20-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a history of amenorrhea for 4 months and per vaginal bleeding. On ultrasound, she has a large placenta and a gestational sac. A suction evacuation is performed. Karyotyping of the villi reveals a triploid karyotype. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?
Which of the following statements is true regarding a follicular cyst?

answers.option: Clinically present with heavy menstrual bleeding
Result of a persistant unruptured Graafian follicle

question: A 35-year-old female undergoes surgery for a large ovarian cyst. The cyst is unilocular and contains cheesy material, hair, and teeth. Microscopically it is lined by skin with sebaceous glands and hair follicles. Other areas show mature fatty tissue, cartilage, and thyroid follicles. No primitive tissue is seen. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 32-year-old female patient is seen in the clinic with genital sores, which are painless and well-circumscribed. Examination shows lymphadenopathy in the associated nodes. A swab was taken and microscopy was performed. It showed cork-screw-shaped bacilli under dark-field microscopy. What is the most likely cause of these findings?
Seminomas are the most common germ cell tumors in males. Which of the following statements regarding seminomas is true?

answers.option: The variant that occurs in men above 65 years has often metastasized at time of diagnosis
The characteristic clear cell appearance of seminoma cells is due to increased lipid in the cells
Areas of hemorrhage and necrosis are common
Increased level of HCG Indicates a syncytiotrophoblastic component
It is the most common tumor in infants

question: A 23-year-old married female presents with the complaint of abrupt onset of heavy vaginal bleeding for the past 2 hours. Her husband gives the history that she missed 2 menstrual cycles and her pregnancy test is positive. Her Blood pressure is low and her pulse is weak and thready. Haemoglobin is low (6 g/dl). Ultrasound shows no fetus in the uterus, but a gestational sac is seen in the ampulla of the left fallopian tube. What is your next course of action?

answers.option: Advise bedrest and call her for follow up in 2 weeks
Refer her to a general surgeon as she does not have a gynecological problem
Give her an appointment at the antenatal clinic near her home
Ask her to go home and drink plenty of fluids
Perform emergency surgery for ruptured ectopic pregnancy

question: Which of the following is a major synthetic estrogen?
Which of these is a main complication of estrogen therapy?

answers.option: Estrogens enhance the rate of resorption of bone

question: Which of the following agents is considered a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM)?
Which of the following is the most appropriate clinical indication for raloxifene?
Which of the following antiandrogen agents is the most appropriate for the treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia?
Which of the following routes of administration is generally used for testosterone and its C17-ester analogs?
Which of the following is a clinical indication for androgens to be used in females?

A 3-day-old female child, delivered by a lower segment cesarean section at 38 weeks of gestation is brought to the emergency room with a complaint of brownish discoloration of urine. On examination, she has a palpable mass in the right flank. Her mother has a history of pre-gestational diabetes. Birth weight is 4.0 kg, length 55 cm. CBC: Hb 22 gm/dl TLC: 15,000 platelets 75000/microliter. Urine detailed report shows numerous red blood cells. What is the most likely cause of this problem?

A newborn delivered by a spontaneous vaginal delivery at 36 weeks of gestation is brought to the emergency department with respiratory distress since birth. On examination, her temperature is 99.8 °F, respiratory rate is 65 breaths/minute, grunting is observed, intercostal recessions, sternal recession, and cyanosis are noted. Breath sounds are diminished along with fine crackles on deep inspiration. Chest X-ray shows diffuse fine reticular granularity of the parenchyma. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 75-year-old post-menopausal female presents to the clinic with a complaint of vaginal heaviness. She has a past history of decompensated heart disease. Examination shows a second-degree vaginal prolapse. Echocardiogram shows less than a 20% ejection fraction. Pelvic sonography is normal. What is the most suitable management option in this case?

A 40-year-old female para 4+0 presents to the clinic with complaints of heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhea for 6 months. On examination, her abdomen is soft and non-tender, and her uterus is 9-10 cm in size. What is the most appropriate diagnosis?

A 39-year-old nulliparous female, married for 5 years presents with painful menstruation for 6 years. The pain increases with the duration of the menstrual cycle and is maximum at the end of the cycle. Her ultrasound pelvis shows a left-sided ovarian cyst of dimensions 6 cm x 4 cm. What is the best management option for this patient?
A teenage male college student reports urinary frequency, dysuria, and clear urethral discharge. The routine culture was inconclusive. Which of the following is likely to explain his condition?

A 34-year-old woman presents with severe abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding. She had amenorrhea for 3 months. Her ultrasound shows a dilated fallopian tube. A provisional diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy is made. What can be expected on microscopy of the tube?

answers.option: Dilated tube with chorionic villi and decidua
Hemorrhage necrosis and sheets of trophoblasts with atypia and mitosis
Large swollen villi with trophoblastic proliferation
Intermediate trophoblasts and a well-developed placenta

question: A 50-year-old post-menopausal woman presents with pruritus in vulva and perianal area. On examination, there are wide areas with small ulcer on vulva. No other co-morbidity is present. What is the best treatment option for her?

A newborn delivered by a lower segment cesarean section at 39 weeks of gestation is brought to the physician for a checkup. The mother has a history of uncontrolled diabetes during pregnancy. On examination, the baby is vitally stable with normal primitive reflexes. His random blood sugar is 35 gm/dL initially. Breastfeeding is advised. After half an hour baby becomes irritable and jittery. What is the best next step for management?

answers.option: Admit the patient in NICU and give maintenance fluid
A bolus of 10% dextrose water (4 ml/kg) IV in should be given
Continue breast feeding more frequently and recheck RBS 2 hourly
0.5 ml/kg oral 40% dextrose gel should be given
A bolus of 25% dextrose water (2 ml/kg) IV in should be given

question: What is the site at which the pudendal nerve block is given before an instrumental delivery?

answers.option: Behind and above the ischial spine
Behind and below the ischial spine

question: According to Integrated Management of Newborn and Childhood Illness (IMNCI), what age is a young infant?
Tamoxifen belongs to which of the following drug classes?
Which of the following drugs is used for the induction of ovulation?

A 23-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of vaginal discharge for the past three days. On pelvic examination, the discharge is white in color and has a foul fishy odor. She is diagnosed with bacterial vaginosis. Which of the following is/are the most appropriate choice of medication(s) for bacterial vaginosis?
Which of the following is the mechanism of action of finasteride?

answers.option: Increase the serum levels of androstendione
Increase the serum levels of testosterone

question: Which of the following symptoms is likely to occur in the intermediate period of 3-10 years after menopause?
Which of the following medications works as an antagonist of progesterone?
Which of the following is the most common cause of secondary dysmenorrhea?

A 21-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of vaginal discharge. On per speculum examination, a red and inflamed cervix is seen. Which of the following organisms is the most common cause of pelvic inflammatory disease?
Immediately after delivery, the uterine fundus lies at which of the following levels?
Which hormone supports the development of follicles till the antral stage?
Which of the following is the most appropriate prenatal diagnostic method for hemoglobinopathies?

A 17-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of heavy menstrual bleeding and irregular menstrual cycles for the past year. Her physical examination is unremarkable. All her laboratory results are within normal range. Which of the following causes will cause such a presentation in this age group?

A 17-year-old girl presents to the clinic with a complaint of excess body hair. Her laboratory results show no significant findings. Her BMI is 24 kg/m2 and her blood pressure is normal. Which of the following is the likely cause of the excessive hair growth in this patient?
Endometrial cancer is found to involve the entire body of the uterus with more than 50% invasion. What is the stage?
Internal cervical os is present between which of the following structures?
Which of the following conditions is not included in IMNCI?
Which of the following side effects will be caused by warfarin when taken during pregnancy?

A 26-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with a history of vaginal bleeding for the past 2 hours. On examination, the cervical os is closed. Ultrasound reveals the fetus in the uterus and fetal heart sounds are positive. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is a modifiable risk factor to prevent polyhydramnios?
Administration of progesterone causes which of the following affects?

A child presents to the clinic with sunken eyes. On examination, the skin pinch goes back slowly and the child is eager to drink when offered water. How will the dehydration be classified according to IMNCI?

A five-month-old boy is brought to a pediatric outpatient department with 3 days of fever, loose stools, and vomiting. He is also having convulsions. According to the IMNCI guidelines, what is the appropriate classification of this illness?
A baby is vaccinated on day 1, 6 weeks of age, and 10 weeks of age and is now due to get vaccination at 14 weeks of age. According to EPI, which vaccinations are administered at 14 weeks of age?
Which of the following internal organs will be present in a person suffering from androgen insensitivity syndrome?
A woman presents in her first trimester of pregnancy with the complaint of on and off constipation. What is the best initial step in the management of this patient?
A pregnant female at 28 weeks of gestation has a blood pressure of 140/90 mm of Hg measured on two separate occasions. Urine dipstick shows proteinuria of 2+. What is the diagnosis?
A woman G4 P4 presents to the clinic with abdominal pain and blurred vision. During the examination, she develops a seizure. What is the immediate step in the management of this patient?
Which congenital malformation of the genital tract is a patient likely to have, if their urethral opening is present on the dorsal surface of the penile shaft?

A 23-year-old nulliparous woman presents to the clinic with complaints of abdominal pain and heavy menstrual bleeding for the past 3 months. On examination, a pelvic mass of approximately 18 weeks in size is palpated. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 38-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a complaint of vaginal discharge that is brown in color. She also gives a history of a miscarriage that happened one year ago. On pelvic examination, lumps are felt in the uterus, a biopsy of which reveals proliferating syncytiotrophoblasts and cytotrophoblasts. There are no chorionic villi identified. This tumor also has a high propensity to metastasize to the brain and liver. Which of the following is appropriate regarding this tumor?

answers.option: It has an excellant prognosis after evacuation and chemotherapy
It has a really poor prognosis after diagnosis
It needs continuous alpha fetoprotein level monitoring
The most common site for it's metastasis is the brain
The ovarian form of this tumor is less aggresive

question: A 23-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with complaints of vaginal bleeding and grape-like cysts passing through the vagina. She also states that she is 8 weeks pregnant. A karyotype of the cystic mass reveals a triploid karyotype. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?
A 34-year-old woman passes away after a spontaneous vaginal delivery due to postpartum hemorrhage. What is the cause of maternal mortality in this case scenario?

An 8-year-old boy presents to the clinic with a painless swelling in his right scrotum. On further evaluation, he is found to have a testicular tumor. Biopsy of the tumor reveals a heterogeneous mixture of cartilage tissues, hair, sebaceous glands, and neural tissue. Which of the following tumors will show these morphological findings on biopsy?

A 1-year-old child presents to the clinic with a complaint of cough for the past three days. On examination, he is afebrile and no subcostal recessions are observed. He is able to breastfeed as per usual. What is the classification of this child's disease according to IMNCI?
Which of the following medications is the most appropriate drug of choice for neonatal seizures?

A 70-year-old woman presents to the clinic with the complaint of an increase in the frequency of micturition and excessive bloating. On pelvic examination, a mass can be felt. On further evaluation, she is found to have an ovarian tumor. On gross appearance, the tumor has multiple cystic lesions filled with serous fluid with papillary projections. Which of the following is the most appropriate regarding this tumor?

answers.option: It is associated with pseudomyxoma peritonei
Low parity is a risk reducing factor
Most likely to occur during the ages of 40-59

question: A 24-year-old lady presents to the clinic with a complaint of irregular menstrual cycles. If the cause of her irregular menstruation is anovulatory cycles, an ultrasound of the ovaries is likely to show which of the following cysts?

A baby is born at 35 weeks of gestational age and the weight of the baby is between the 10th and 90th centile expected for his gestational age. How will you classify this baby's gestational age and weight?

answers.option: Preterm and normal for gestational age
Term and small for gestational age
Preterm and small for gestational age
Term and large for gestational age
Post term and normal for gestational age

question: A 23-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of pain in her right breast. She also states that she gave birth 1 month ago and she is currently breastfeeding her baby. On examination, the woman is febrile and her breast is erythematous and tender. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 27-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of bloody discharge from her right nipple. On examination, she is afebrile, and a mass is palpable on her right breast. The doctor orders a mammogram which shows a solitary subareolar nodule with dilation of the ducts. A biopsy of the lesion shows a central fibrovascular core, extending from the walls of the duct, occupying the lumen and lined by myoepithelial cells. Which of the following conditions is the likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of pain and swelling in her left breast. On examination, she is afebrile and a mass is palpable on her left breast. Biopsy of the lesion reveals an enlarged terminal duct lobular unit with compression and distortion of the acini. The acini are arranged in a swirling pattern. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis based on the histological findings on biopsy?

A 50-year-old female is referred to the breast clinic after linear calcifications are detected on the screening mammogram of the right breast. On examination, her breasts are non-tender, and no mass can be felt. The physician decides to get a biopsy done, which reveals tumor cells that are pleomorphic with high-grade nuclei, large central zones of necrosis, and calcifications that fill several ducts. Which of the following will present these morphological features on biopsy?

A 20-year-old male presents to the clinic with a complaint of swelling in his left scrotum. Upon further inquiry, he reveals that the swelling came to his notice after a baseball game during which he suffered some trauma to the scrotal region. On examination, the swelling is non-tender, and firm and does not transilluminate on the transillumination test. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 22-year-old boy presents to the clinic with complaints of left-sided testicular swelling and pain for the past 8 days. On general examination, he is febrile. Upon examination of the scrotum, it is found to be tender and appears erythematous. Phrens sign is positive. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 17-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with the complaint of sudden onset of pain in the left testicle radiating to the upper abdomen. He also complains of nausea and vomiting since the onset of pain. On examination, a high-riding left testis is found. Phrens sign is negative. Which of the following measures must be taken in this case?

A 30-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with swelling in his right scrotum for the past two weeks. On examination, the swelling is non-tender, firm, and does not transilluminate. A biopsy reveals glomeruli-like structures and immunohistochemical staining is positive for alpha-fetoprotein. Which of the following statements is most appropriate regarding this tumor?

answers.option: Glomeruli-like structures are called exner bodies
In adults it occurs along with embryonal carcinoma
The tumor cells consist of syncytiotrophoblast and cytotrophoblast cells
It consists of sheets of undifferentiated cells with primitive glandular differentiation
It has a poor prognosis in infants and up to 3 years of age

question: A 20-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of irregular menstrual cycles for the past three months. She also complains that she has noticed an increased growth of hair on her face. Her BMI is 32 kg/m². Which of the following is the most appropriate initial drug of choice for this patient?

A 50-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of bloody discharge from the nipples and swelling in her right breast. On examination of the breast, a lump can be felt in the subareolar region and there is ulceration over the nipple. The physician orders a biopsy, which shows that the tumor is HER2 positive. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 38-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of absence of menstruation for the past 18 months. She also reports a decline in her libido. On pelvic examination, dryness of the vulva and vagina can be appreciated. Which of the following findings will likely be present in this patient?

A 45-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of intermenstrual bleeding for the past three months. On pelvic examination, a cervical mass can be palpated, which bleeds on touch. Which of the following investigations will further aid in diagnosis?

A 23-year-old female presents to the emergency department with a complaint of vaginal bleeding and abdominal cramps for the past 2 hours. Upon further inquiry, she reveals that she has not been menstruating for the past 8 weeks. On examination, her abdomen is tender. The urine dipstick test is positive for pregnancy. Which of the following is the next step for the confirmation of diagnosis?

A 23-year-old female presents to the clinic with a complaint of irregular menstrual bleeding for the past three months. On examination, the abdomen is non-tender and a mass of 12 weeks in size can be palpated. Which of the following is the best treatment option for this patient?

A 23-year-old woman presents to the clinic for a scheduled checkup. She is 30 weeks pregnant and she is concerned about her baby having thalassemia since it runs in the family. Which of the following is the most appropriate statement?

answers.option: Cordocentesis can be performed around 20 weeks of gestation
Cordocentesis can be performed around 10 weeks of gestation
Amniocentesis can be done around 10 weeks of gestation
Amniocentesis has a 5% chance of miscarriage
Chorionic villous sampling can be performed around 18 weeks of gestation

question: A 23-year-old female presents to the clinic with complaints of inability to menstruate and breastfeed her baby for the past 8 months. She further reports that she delivered her last baby 8 months ago and suffered from severe postpartum hemorrhage. Which of the following is the likely cause of this patient's presentation?

A 65-year-old woman presents to the gynecology clinic with complaints of post-menopausal bleeding along with vaginal dryness and soreness. The physician orders an endometrial biopsy, which comes out to be normal. Which of the following management options is/are the most appropriate for this patient?

A 32-year-old woman presented to the clinic with 38 weeks of amenorrhea. Her past medical history was significant for an intrauterine death at term for a female baby that weighed 3.8 kilograms. The doctor ordered baseline tests and her random blood sugar came out to be 188 mg/dl. Which of the following tests will aid in assessing the patient's risk of fetal loss?

A neonate was brought by his parents to the emergency department by his parents after they noticed yellowish discoloration on his skin. The mother further revealed that her blood group is O+ and her baby's blood group is B+. The doctor ordered a complete blood picture and the peripheral smear revealed the presence of spherocytes. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 23-year-old female was rushed to the emergency department as she felt something coming out of her vagina. She further revealed she was 38 weeks pregnant. On pelvic examination, the cord was felt at the cervix. Which of the following is the most appropriate management option?

answers.option: Discharge and ask her to come after 24 hours

question: A 26-year-old female was rushed to the emergency department by her husband when she was found collapsed on the ground. The patient's husband further revealed that his wife had been having severe abdominal cramps and vaginal bleeding for the past 2 hours and that his wife was 7 weeks pregnant. Which of the following is the best course of management?

answers.option: Start IV fluids and then assess after 24 hours

question: A 38-year-old female presents to the clinic with the complaint of absence of menstruation for the past 6 months. She also complains of dryness and itching around her vagina. Which of the following is likely to be present in this patient?
Which of the following is the most common cause of first trimester fetal loss?
